Hi.
 Those sorts of holes are sometimes seen on tsuba that have been
recycled at least once in the West. It was once distressingly common to
wire, sometimes solder, tsuba to some sort of frame or mesh for
"decorative" purposes.
 Arnold

>>> ikkanshi@... 07/27/05 8:22 PM >>>
All, in this tsuba ( Owari or Kyo Shoami maybe ?? ) in the punch marks 
on the face, are 3 distinct pin holes or drill holes. Are these to 
enable the metal to be broken away easier when punching out the iron ?. 
Seems reasonable.

http://www.l-wise.co.jp/sword/sdata43/egk251-02.jpg

http://www.l-wise.co.jp/sword/sdata43/egk251-05.jpg

http://www.l-wise.co.jp/sword/sdata43/egk251-04.jpg

Any thoughts welcome.

Cheers

rich
